thread.title: Offense gains 612 yards in Rams win over Ames
thread.title_full: Offense gains 612 yards in Rams win over Ames

author: desmoinesregister.com
title: Offense gains 612 yards in Rams win over Ames
text:
Buy Photo Southeast Polk Michael Treager tackles Ames Austin Barrientos in the first half on Friday night. (Photo: Reese Strickland/For the Register) Buy Photo
CONNECT TWEET The Southeast Polk Rams improved to 3-0 in District 1 play and 4-3 overall with a 49-28 home victory over the Ames Little Cyclones last Friday night. The Rams had their best offensive outing of the season as they passed for 267 yards and rushed for 345 yards for 612 total yards and 49 total points.
The Rams scored on their first possession of the game when quarterback Thomas McLaughlin connected with Cole Hauser on a 64-yard touchdown pass. Ames took a brief lead in the contest when they recovered a Ram fumble on their own 7-yard line and carried it into the end zone. Ames connected on an 18-yard touchdown pass and moved out to a 14-7 lead in the first quarter.
McLaughlin hit Parker Drees on a 54-yard scoring pass to even the score at 14-all at the close of the first quarter.
The Rams moved ahead 27-14 in the second quarter on TD runs of 19 yards and 4 yards by Cole Hauser. Ames scored on a 31-yard touchdown pass and Hauser dashed 74 yards for his third touchdown of the period and the half ended with the Rams leading 34-21.
Ames took the opening possession of the second half and scored on an 11-yard run. McLaughlin passed to Austin Sutten for a 34-yard touchdown and dashed 25 yards for another score in the fourth quarter to give the Rams their fourth consecutive win.
McLaughlin had a big night, completing 15-of-24 passes for 244 yards and three touchdowns, and gaining 109 yards on 18 carries for another touchdown. Hauser carried 26 times for three touchdowns to lead the Ram ground attack.
Head coach Brad Zelenovich said he was happy with the performance of his offensive unit.
Offensive linemen Cole Hassman (LT), Colten Chiles (LG), Sam Hermes (C), Nick Tart (RG) and Jake Howell (RT) led the Ram ground game.
"Those guys are getting better and we are getting back to Southeast Polk football - running the ball - being physical and exciting to watch. It was a good win, they are a good team," said Zelenovich. "We had some mistakes early, but overcame them. We had some guys step up and make some plays on both sides of the ball and in the kicking game."
The Ram defense was led by Eric Pingel (LB), who had 10 tackle points with one sack and Michael Traeger (LB) who had 8 tackle points and one sack. Michael Altes (DB) and Kameron Padavich (DL) combined for 15 tackle points.
"We had been playing a three-four all season and hadn't seen any spread teams up to this point," defensive coordinator Don Starcevich said. "They came out with a spread offense and it took a while to adjust and the kids bought into the plan, did their job and got it done."
The Rams travel to Sioux City Friday, where they meet Sioux City North (0-3, 1-6) in another Division 1 contest.
